turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: We're just going to go into one of the other rooms for a few minutes and talk - then I'll come back and check on you, okay?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: We'll get something as soon as we get to the hotel, okay?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Okay, Mom.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Hey, wasn't it around here that the Donner party got snowbound?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Jack...

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't worry, Mom.  I know all about cannabilism, I saw it on T.V.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Danny, come on over here.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Okay.  You behave yourself.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: The loser has to keep American clean, how's that?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: And you're gonna lose.  And I'm gonna get you - you betta run fast! Look out - I'm coming in close. All right?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Okay Danny, you win.  Let's take the rest of this walking, huh?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Okay...oh!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Give me your hand.  Oh, isn't it beautiful.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Oh what a Maze.  Isn't it beautiful.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: It's so pretty.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I didn't think it was going to be this big, did you?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mom?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Can I go to my room and get my fire-engine?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Not right now, Daddy's asleep.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I won't make any noise.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Come on, Doc.  He only went to bed a few hours ago.  Can't you wait till later?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I won't make a sound, I promise. I'll tip-toe.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Well all right.  But really don't make a sound.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I won't, Mom.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Make sure you come right back, 'cause I'm going to make lunch soon. Okay?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Okay, Mom.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: If Jack won't come with us, we'll just have to tell him that we are going by ourselves.  That's all there is to it.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Red Rum.  Red Rum.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Danny?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Red Rum.  Red Rum.  Red Rum.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Red Rum.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Danny... what's the matter, hon?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Red Rum.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Are you having a bad dream?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Danny.  Danny, stop it.  Danny!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Red Rum.  Red Rum.  Red Rum.  Red Rum.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mommy...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Danny, come here!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mommy... Mommy...!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Danny!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mommy!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Now Danny, when you were brushing your teeth, do you remember if you smelled anything funny, or saw any bright flashing lights, or anything at all strange?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Do you remember when you were brushing your teeth?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What's the next thing you remember after you were brushing your teeth?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Mommy saying, 'Wake up, wake up, wake up Danny, wake up.'

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Now Danny, can you remember what you were doing just before you started brushing your teeth?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Talking to Tony.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Is Tony one of your animals?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No.  It's the little boy that lives in my mouth.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Oh,

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: if you were to open your mouth now, could I see Tony?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Because he hides.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Where does he go?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: To my stomach.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Does Tony ever tell you to do things?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Now I'm going to ask you to do me a favor, and stay quietly in bed for the rest of the day.  Okay?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Do I have to?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yes, I'd like you to.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Shall we go into the living room?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mrs. Torrance, I don't think you have anything to worry about.  I'm quite sure there is nothing physically wrong with Danny.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  Oh, yeah, he seems absolutely fine now, but you should have seen him.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: But eh what was the matter with him?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Mrs. Torrance, most of the time these episodes with kids are never explained.  They are brought on by emotional factors, and they rarely occur again.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Have you been in Boulder long, Mrs. Torrance?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Only about three months.  Eh we're from Vermont.  My husband was teaching school there.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Did the appearance of Danny's imaginary friend...?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Tony.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Did Tony's first appearance happen to coincide with your arrival here?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: No, um let's see I guess Danny started talkin to Tony about the time we put him into nursery school.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What sort of injury did he have?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Ah he dislocated his shoulder.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How did he manage to do that?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Well it's just one of those things. You know... purely an accident, um. My husband had oh... been drinking, and he came home about three hours late, so he wasn't exactly in the greatest mood that night.  And well Danny had scattered some of his school papers all over the room... and my husband grabbed his arm, you know, and pulled him away from them. It's...it's just the sort of thing you do a hundred times with a child - you know, in a park or on the streets - but on this particular occasion my husband just... used too much strength and he injured Danny's arm.

turns.speaker: HERMIE
turns.text: Oh I wouldn't think of it.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Well how can I repay you?

turns.speaker: HERMIE
turns.text: It's okay, really.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Well I'm going to have some coffee. Would you like some?

turns.speaker: HERMIE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Great.  Sit down.  Oh these marvellous doughnuts, help yourself. Coffee will be ready in a few minutes.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I'm afraid it's advocaat sir.  It tends to stain.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Advocaat is it?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Yes sir.  Look um... I think the best thing is to come along to the gentlemen's room, sir, and eh...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: That doesn't matter, sir.  You're the important one.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Awfully nice of you to say.  Of course I intend to change my jacket this evening before the fish and goose soiree.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Won't keep you a moment, sir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Grady?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Delbert Grady.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: That's right, sir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: haven't I seen you somewhere before?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Why no, sir.  I don't believe so.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Ah ha, it's coming off now, sir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Eh... Mr. Grady... weren't you once the caretaker here?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Why no, sir.  I don't believe so.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Yes, sir.  I have a wife and eh two daughters, sir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And, er... where are they now?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Oh, they're somewhere around.  I'm not quite sure at the moment, sir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: He is, Mr. Torrance.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: A nigger.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A nigger!

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: A nigger cook.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Your son has a very great talent. I don't think you are aware how great it is, but he is attempting to use that very talent against your will.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, he is a very willful boy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She eh... interferes.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Perhaps they need a good talking to, if you don't mind my saying so. Perhaps a bit more.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: It's Grady, Mr. Torrance.  Delbert Grady.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Grady... oh.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No need to rub it in, Mr. Grady. I'll deal with that situation as soon as I get out of here.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Will you indeed, Mr. Torrance.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Just give me one more chance to prove it, Mr. Grady.  That's all I ask.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Your wife appears to be stronger than we imagined, Mr. Torrance. Somewhat more resourceful, she seems to have got the better of you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: For the moment, Mr. Grady.  Only for the moment.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I fear that you will have to deal with this matter in the harshest possible way, Mr. Torrance.  I fear that is the only thing to do.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's nothing I look forward to with the greater pleasure, Mr. Grady.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: You give your word on that do you, Mr. Torrance?

turns.speaker: RANGER
turns.text: Good evening.  Forest Service.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Hallo.  My name's Dick Halloran. I'm the Head Chef up at the Overlook Hotel.

turns.speaker: RANGER
turns.text: Good evening, Mr. Halloran.  What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Sir, I've been trying to make an urgent phone call up there,

turns.speaker: RANGER
turns.text: I'd be glad to do that, sir.  Oh why don't you call me back in about eh twenty minutes?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Thank you very much.  I'll do that.

turns.speaker: RANGER
turns.text: All right, sir.

turns.speaker: RANGER
turns.text: Good evening.  Forest Service.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Hallo, this is Dick Halloran again. I called a while ago about the folks at the Overlook Hotel.

turns.speaker: ULLMAN
turns.text: Oh Dick, come on over and say hello to Mr. and Mrs. Torrance.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ULLMAN
turns.text: This is Dick Halloran, our Head Chef.

turns.speaker: ULLMAN
turns.text: The Torrances are going to take care of the Overlook for us this winter.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Oh, that's just great.  How do you folks like our hotel so far?

turns.speaker: ULLMAN
turns.text: Dick, if you're ready to do it now, I think it would be a good idea if you could show Mrs. Torrance the kitchen, while I continue on with Jack.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: It will be a pleasure.  Right this way Mrs. Torrance.

turns.speaker: ULLMAN
turns.text: Dick, can we borrow Mrs. Torrance for a few minutes?  We're on our way through to the basement - I promise we won't keep her very long.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: No problem, Mr. Ullman.  I was just getting to the ice cream.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Glad to meet you, Winifred.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Mrs. Torrance, your husband introduced you as Winifred.  Now are you a Winnie or a Freddie?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I'm a Wendy.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Oh Wendy.  That's nice.  That's the prettiest.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: God.  This is the kitchen, huh?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Yeah, this is it.  How do you like it, Danny?  Is it big enough for you?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Don't let it get you down Mrs. Torrance - it's big but it still ain't nothing but a kitchen... a lot of the stuff you'll never have to touch.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I wouldn't know what to do with it if I did.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Well one thing for sure, you don't have to worry about food because you folks could eat up here a whole year and never have the same menu twice.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Beg pardon?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Doc.  You called Danny 'Doc' twice just now.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: I did?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yeah.  We call him Doc sometimes, you know, like in the Bugs Bunny cartoons.  But how did you know that?

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Well I guess I probably heard you call him that.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: No, we don't mind.

turns.speaker: HALLORAN
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Sound good to you, Danny?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Bill, how do you do?

turns.speaker: WATSON
turns.text: Pleased to meet you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pleasure to meet you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Eh - formerly a school-teacher.

turns.speaker: WATSON
turns.text: What line of work are you in now?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm a writer um... Teaching has been more or less a way of making ends meet.

turns.speaker: WATSON
turns.text: Well this ought to be quite a change for you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, I'm looking for a change.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: What'll it be?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now I'm awfully glad you asked me that, Lloyd, because I just happen to have two twenties and two tens right here in my wallet.  I was afraid they were going to be there until next April.  So here's what: you slip me a bottle of Bourbon, a glass and some ice.  You can do that, can't you, Lloyd?  You're not to busy, are you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How's my credit in this joint anyway?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Your credit's fine, Mr. Torrance.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's swell.  I like you, Lloyd. I always liked you.  You were always the best of them.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Best goddamned bartender from Timbuctoo to Portland Maine - Portland Oregon for that matter.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Thank you for saying so.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: How are things going, Mr. Torrance?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Things could be better, Lloyd. Things could be a whole lot better.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: I hope it's nothing serious.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nothing that I can't handle though, Lloyd.  Thanks.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Women!  Can't live with 'em.  Can't live without 'em!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hi Lloyd.  I've been away.  Now I'm back.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Good evening Mr. Torrance.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: It's good to see you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's good to be back, Lloyd.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: What'll it be, sir?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No charge?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Your money's no good here.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm the kind of man likes to know who's buying their drinks, Lloyd.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: It's not a matter that concerns you, Mr. Torrance - at least not at this point.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hi, babe.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Hi, hon.  How's it going?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Great.  Look, I'm at the hotel and I still have an awful lot to go through.  I don't think I can get home before nine or ten.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Boy, we must be really high up. The air feels so different.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh...huh.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sure is.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: God, I've never seen anything like this before.  Are all of these Indian designs authentic?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Perfect for a child.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Good Morning, hon.  Your breakfast is ready.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: It's about eleven thirty.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Eleven thirty - Jesus!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I guess we've been staying up too late.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know it.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I made 'em just the way you like 'em, sunny side up.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hmm, nice.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: It's really pretty outside.  How about taking me for a walk after you've finished your breakfast?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh I suppose I oughta try to do some writing first.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Any ideas yet?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Lots of ideas.  No good ones.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Well, something'll come.  It's just a matter of settling back into the habit of writing every day.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah... that's all it is.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: It's really nice up here, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I love it.  I really do.  I've never been this happy, or comfortable anywhere.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yeah.  It's amazing how fast you get used to such a big place.  I tell you, when we first came up here, I thought it was kinda scarey.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you want me to do about it?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Ah, come on hon.  Don't be so grouchy.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not being grouchy.  I just want to finish my work.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Okay.  I understand.  I'll come back later on with a couple of sandwiches for you and... maybe you'll let me read something then.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wendy,  let me explain something to you. Whenever you come in here and interrupt me, you're breaking my concentration.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: and it will then take me time to get back to where I was, understand?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fine.  Now we're going to make a new rule.  Whenever I am in here and you hear me typing,

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: or whether you don't hear me typing, whatever the fuck you hear me doing in here, when I am in here that means that I am working - that means don't come in.  Now do you think you can handle that?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Fine.  Why don't you start right now and get the fuck out of here, hmm?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I had... I had the most terrible nightmare I ever had.  It's the most horrible dream I ever had.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: It's okay.  It's okay, now.  Really.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I dreamed that I... that I killed you and Danny.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: No.  It's the truth, really.  I swear it.  Danny told me.  He went up into one of the bedrooms, the door was open, and he saw this crazy woman in the bath-tub.  She tried to strangle him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Which room was it?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Did you find anything?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, nothing at all.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: You went into the room Danny said - to 237?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yes, I did.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: And you didn't see anything at all?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Absolutely nothing.  How is he?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: He's still asleep.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Somebody did that to him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think he did it to himself.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Get him out of here?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You mean just leave the hotel?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shovellings out driveways, work in a car wash - any of that appeal to you?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wendy, I have let you fuck up my life so far, but I'm not going to let you fuck this up!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How do you like it?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I can't really remember.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You can't remember.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't think that's true.  I think you have some very definite ideas about what should be done with Danny... and I'd like to know what they are.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Well I... I think maybe he should be taken to a doctor.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You think maybe he should be taken to a doctor?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: When do you think maybe he should be taken to a doctor?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: As soon as possible.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Jack...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Of course I am.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Of course you are.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Have you ever thought about my responsibilities?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Oh Jack, what are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Have you ever had a single moment's thought about my responsibilities? Have you ever thought for a single solitary moment about my responsibilities to my employers?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Stay away from me!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I just want to go back to my room.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why?
